snippet: The Most Rev. Justin Welby, the spiritual leader of the Anglican Church, invited 37 primates to meet in Britain next January to “discuss key issues face to face.”
abstract: Most Rev Justin Welby, leader of Anglican Church, calls Anglican leaders around world to meet in 2016 to discuss church's divided views on issues including same-sex marriage; meeting may result in much looser ties among factions, allowing for greater independence.

byline.contributor: Laurie Goodstein contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The Most Rev. Justin Welby, the spiritual leader of the Anglican Church, invited 37 primates to meet in Britain next January to “discuss key issues face to face.”

headline.main: Meeting of Anglican Leaders Could Lead to a Looser Federation
headline.print_headline: Meeting of Anglican Leaders Could Result in Looser Federation

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
